required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: TEAS-induced Analgesia: Dual vs Single Acupoints
clinical_study.official_title: Transcutaneous Electrical Acupoint Stimulation Decreases Remifentanil Consumption and Postoperative Pain in Patients Undergoing Radical Mastectomy: Dual Acupoints Versus Single Acupoint in a Prospective Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effects of transcutaneous electric acupoint stimulation(TEAS) at single acupoint or dual acupoints on opioid consumption and postoperative pain in patients undergoing radical mastectomy

study_design_info.masking_description: For all patients, electrodes were placed at the bilateral PC6 and RN17 and connected to the Hwato Electric Acupuncture Treatment Instrument. No patients in the study had previous experience of undergoing transcutaneous electrical stimulation treatment. Patients were told that they might or might not feel the electrical stimulation. Interventions were performed by a designated investigator who was not involved in the anaesthesia or the follow-up. The stimulator was placed in an opaque box to blind the surgical team and the anaesthetists to the group allocation.

primary_outcome.time_frame: from start of anesthesia to extubation, on average 2 hours

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from end of remifentanil infusion to patient response to verbal command,approximately 10 minutes on average
from end of remifentanil infusion to extubation,approximately 10 minutes on average

secondary_outcome.measure: incidence of respiratory depression during recovery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from extubation to discharge from post anesthesia care unit, approximately 40 minutes on average

secondary_outcome.measure: incidence of nausea and vomiting during recovery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from extubation to discharge from post anesthesia care unit, approximately 40 minutes on average
from arriving to discharge from post anesthesia care unit, approximately 30 minutes on average

secondary_outcome.measure: visual analogue scale at 24 hour after surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from end of surgery to 24 hours after surgery, totally 24 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: pain score at 3 months after surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from discharge from hospital to 3 months after surgery, approximately 3 months

secondary_outcome.measure: pain score at 6 months after surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from discharge from hospital to 6 months after surgery, approximately 3 months

arm_group.description: transcutaneous electric acupoint stimulation is given at bilateral neiguan or 30min before anesthesia induction
transcutaneous electric acupoint stimulation is given at Danzhong and bilateral neiguan or 30min before anesthesia induction

intervention.description: electrodes are attached o the skin and electric stimulation is given
electrodes are attached o the skin but no stimulation is given

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients aged from 18 to 65 yrs
- body mass index (BMI) of 18 to 30 kg/m2
- elective radical mastectomy under general anesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- contradictions to electric stimulation
- difficulties in communication
- histories of general anesthesia, drug or alcohol abuse or addiction
- cardiac dysfunction or severe hypertension, confirmed hepatic dysfunction and renal impairment
- participants recruited into other clinical trials during last three months
